Is there another way to decode a raw transaction in Verus, aside from using the command-line interface?

Yes, you can also decode a raw transaction in Verus using the JSON-RPC API. You can use a tool like `curl` to send a JSON-RPC request to the Verus node. The format of the request is:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "decoderawtransaction", "params": ["hexstring"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Replace "myusername" with your actual username, and "hexstring" with the actual hex string of the transaction you want to decode.

Examples:
> verus decoderawtransaction "hexstring"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "decoderawtransaction", "params": ["hexstring"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
